Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
May 2023 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Happy 20th anniversary to Justia! This is a remarkable occasion as we celebrate the success and accomplishments of the past two decades. We thank our entire team for their hard work and dedication, which has been instrumental in our company's growth. Looking back on our achievements, we reaffirm our commitment to achieving excellence and building a solid company in the coming years. We are proud to be celebrating this milestone and are excited about what the future holds for our company.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia X Open AI Hackathon. Our Engineering Team had the opportunity to use the Open AI APIs to develop a functional proof of concepts in a two-day Hackathon. New products and features will reflect their learning and contributions in the upcoming months.

IT Team. As always, our team kept on top of our server infrastructure and took care of maintenance and security updates to various Justia properties, such as the Justia Lawyer Directory, Justia Case Law, and JWeb, to name a few.

Justia Lawyer Directory. Our team made multiple improvements to our lawyer directory, including updates to the A2A email invitations, client review moderation tools, and added a Justia Connect Pro promotional block in the Justia Profile dashboard.

Justia Connect. We continue to improve Justia Connect by integrating new features like alerting Justia Connect Pro members about credits expiration and improvements to Justia CLE Webinars. We also added a Justia Connect Pro tooltip on various properties to promote the product better and added a sticky banner to Justia Accounts.

QA Automation Team. Our QA Team expanded our automated QA coverage for some properties, including Justia Brand and Justia Ask A Lawyer, and improved support for our JLD monthly report.

GA4. Continuing with the migration to GA4 for all our public properties, this month, we included tracking for some of our Justia Friends websites, such as Joanna Grossman’s website, Stanford Copyright & Fair Use site, and Eric Goldman's blogs.

Blogging Ideas Migration. This month, we completed the migration of our Blogging Ideas users to the Justia Daily Opinion Summary Newsletters, given that we discontinued that service this month.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal

  • Title Changes to Justia Legal Guides. Following up on the changes to title tags, we updated the titles of many Justia Legal Guides pages. We are looking to increase references to law-related keywords to boost traffic.
  • Supreme Court Justices Bios. We are working on expanding the Justia U.S. Supreme Court Center by adding biographies of each of the 116 Justices who have served on the Court since its creation.
  • Content on Current Legal Issues. In response to the current interest in the cryptocurrency and artificial intelligence areas, we added content to the Justia Legal Guides on some of the legal issues raised by these topics.
  • 50-State Survey on Grandparent Custody/Visitation. We bolstered our Child Custody and Support Center by writing content on how each state addresses grandparents' custody and visitation rights to their grandchildren.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Kshama Kumar

Data Team

Hi everyone! My name is Kshama Kumar. I am 28 years old, from Goa, India. I recently graduated from Seattle University with a Master’s in Computer Science - Data Science specialization. I am usually shy and introverted until I get comfortable. I love to sing and dance. On the creative end, I love organizing events and setting up event spaces (no budget constraints, please). I am excited to be a part of Justia and look forward to working with you all!

JUSTIA PET NEWS

Meet Clumsy Ziggy

Our adorable and ever-growing pup, Ziggy, celebrated his 6-month birthday on April 30th! This playful little guy loves seeking out remote controls in his free time and has already playfully demolished a couple of them! We welcomed Ziggy to our family on March 11th and recently discovered his unique heritage: 30% German Shepherd, 24% American Pit Bull Terrier, 20% American Bully, 12% American Staffordshire Terrier, 8% Rottweiler, and 6% Siberian Husky. Quite an assortment of breeds!

— Jessica Risso

DID YOU KNOW?

Claudia Duque Gave a Conference at the Universidad La Salle Saltillo

In the context of "World Intellectual Property Day", Claudia Duque participated in the "Entrepreneurial Leaders SLW 2023" event at the Universidad La Salle Saltillo. She gave a conference on the importance of trademark registration. It was part of this year's World Intellectual Property Organization's (WIPO) agenda.

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Tetris

Available on Apple TV+

Enjoy the story of one of the most nostalgic and current video games ever: Tetris. How it was developed, the chaos of intellectual property, and the conflict of interest with the Soviet Union. Tenacity can lead us to success, but sometimes the cost involved in the process is extremely high. You will love the graphics, the references, and the storytelling!

- Alejandra Medina

Collaborators: Alejandra Medina, Alejandro Moreno, Arturo Jara, Erika Azuela, Genaro Osoria, Haydee Garcia, Jorge Contreras, Jose Ramos, Lauren Moskie, Miguel Berlanga, Omar Carreon, Rene Peralta, and Zoraida Vallejo.
